questions.question: A conclusion based on incomplete evidence. (speculation, assumption, inference)
Based on observation or experience rather than theory. (observational, practical, experiential)
Doubt about the truth of something. (distrust, disbelief, uncertainty)
To call upon a concept, idea, or authority for support. (summon, appeal to, refer to)
Looking back on past events. (reflective, backward-looking, recollective)
An idea or belief about something. (concept, perception, thought)
To confirm that something is real or valid. (verify, validate, confirm)
The part of the mind that affects behavior without awareness. (unconscious, hidden mind, inner thoughts)
A difference between things that should be the same. (inconsistency, divergence, mismatch)
To become deeply involved in something complex or bizarre.
To give an opinion or input.
